Workout.Desc: Push Ups help build muscles and improve strength throughout the upper body. It targets the chest muscles (pectoralis major), arms (triceps), and the shoulders. For beginners, it is okay to start off with your knees on the floor.

Sit ups work out the rectus abdominis, transverse adbominis, and obliques. In addition to strengthening your core, they ork out your hip flexors, chest, and neck and they foster good posture by working your lower back and glute muscles.

Squats provide a variety of benefits including strengthening your quadriceps, as well has reducing the risks of injuring your knees and ankles. The movement strengthens your tendons, bones, and ligaments around the leg.
